snippet: As the first anniversary of the repeal of “don’t ask, don’t tell” approaches, it is clear that there have been no disastrous consequences.
abstract: Editorial observes that the publication of a detailed study on the one-year-old repeal of the military's ban on openly gay service members reveals that there has been no negative impact to morale or readiness; draws attention to the harm caused to gay service members by the Defense of Marriage Act, which bars same-sex couples who are legally married under state law the same federal benefits that are afforded heterosexual couples.
lead_paragraph: As the first anniversary of the repeal of “don’t ask, don’t tell” approaches, it is clear that there have been no disastrous consequences.
